social_posts.post_text:
I hope everyone's New Year has been a fresh and peaceful start. Last year at this time, I started my #365project endeavor, not having any idea how it would turn out. I'm in the finishing stages of putting the results of my project together into my upcoming e-book, "Moments: A 365-day Photographic Journey," and I will be releasing it soon on my website. 

This image is from day 292 of my project last year, and a quiet moment from the Oregon coast as the fog started lifting. 

#365photoproject #365project #oregon #oregoncoast #landscapephotography #lightrays #fog #coastalphotography #beach #oregonphotography #naturephotography #nikonz2 #nature #landcapes

"Mountain Magic" (2022)⁠
⁠
We had many windy days in the mountains here in Colorado in December, along with a big snowstorm. I headed up into the mountains to watch the wind shape-shift the snow into ephemeral dances that lasted only seconds. ⁠
⁠
#coloradophotography #colorado #rockymountains #rockymountainnationalpark #mountains #winter #snow #wind #landscapephotography #blowingsnow #naturephotography #coloradoinwinter #mountainmagic #windydays #naturelandscapes #winterinthemountains #december

It's Mud Monday! I captured a new mud image in the Mojave a few months ago. During my explorations, I stumbled across this freshly dried mud and enjoyed its metallic-looking surface, enhanced by the soft afternoon desert light. It appears monochrome, but it is not. The color of the mud and the light gave it this unique, gray-toned appearance. ⁠
⁠
I have started Mud Monday again in my Monday stories! I have some fantastic photographers and mud to feature, so if you have a grand landscape, smaller scene or mud abstract, tag it #mudmonday to be featured in my stories on Monday! ⁠
⁠
#mud #mudcracks #mojavemud #mojavedesert #naturalabstract #smallscene #landscapephotography #patterns #textures #abstractphotography #desertphotography #desertlove #california #naturalfeatures #naturephotography #nikonz72

I'm missing the desert pretty badly at the moment. Usually, we're a month into our 2.5-month desert stay by now. Unfortunately, several unexpected events have kept us home in Denver for the past month, but we hope to hit the road to Death Valley soon. The silver lining has been I've gotten caught up on a lot of work, and we did a total remodel, and I now have a dedicated at-home office and print studio. But for right now, I'll reminisce on these twilight dunes from last November until I can get back to the Mojave.⁠
⁠
#mojave #deathvalley #sanddunes #dunes #sand #layers #twilightlight #desertlight #landscapephotography #smallscenes #waves #desertlove #naturephotography #artofvisuals #softlight #photographingsanddunes

After a two-month hiatus at home, we're back on the road to teach. It's been a cold few months in Denver so the warm desert air will be welcoming! ⁠
⁠
I look forward to getting back out in the Mojave and hope to head out at night to capture some celestial and desert magic. ⁠
I photographed this scene last fall, and while I don't photograph scenes like this often, it's a fun departure to create these wide scenes occasionally when I have the chance. Night photography fascinated me when I first picked up my camera years ago, so when the chance occurs, I enjoy a night out. ⁠
⁠
This image is two exposures blended together, captured right after one another. I did one long exposure for the mud tiles and one exposure right after the winter Milky Way. ⁠
On that note, we're excited to lead our Death Valley Night Photography workshop this April to experience more desert landscapes at night!⁠
⁠
#astrophotography #nightsky #desertphotography #mud #milkyway #winternightphotography #mojavedesert #desertlove #desert #landscapesatnight #nightscapes #nikonz72 #nikonnofilter #californiaphotography #landscapephotography #celestialmud #stars #natureatnight #mudcracks #landscapecaptures #capturedlandscapes

Back playing in big sandboxes for the next few weeks...⁠
⁠
#sand #sanddunes #sandstorms #landscapephotography #smallscene #lines #patterns #backlight #naturephotography #landscapecaptures #desertphotography #desertlandscapes #artofvisuals #desertlove #mojave

Fall feels from last autumn with canyon reflections, oils and a leaf 🍂⁠
⁠
#autumn #leaves #oils #smallscene #reflectionsoffall #southwest #wanderinginautumn #fallleaves #canyoncountry #redrocks #utah #quietmoments #landscapephotography #nature #naturephotography #naturecaptures #artofvisuals #exploretocreate #hiketoexplore #nikonz72

"Tempestuous"  2023⁠
⁠
It's been a while since I have posted. I needed to step away for a while, and I find these social media breaks happening more and more frequently. Thanks to those that have reached out, no worries, I am still here and still have a camera in my hand! I've just been a bit quiet lately. ⁠
⁠
This year started slowly and frustratingly, and I feel that I'm still trying to catch my breath. It's only been three months, but this year has brought many changes and clarifying moments that will shape my path forward.⁠
⁠
Social media noise has become too much, so I'm back to basics, focusing on the craft, my vision, and where I want to go next on this photographic adventure, and I'm thankful to have many exciting opportunities in the next few months. ⁠
⁠
This winter in Death Valley had some of the craziest weather I've witnessed in seven winters there. The weather seemed to add to my moods and emotion and played perfectly with everything I was going through. This photo represents one of eight windstorms that blew through while we were there. ⁠
⁠
A big thank-you to my circle of photographer friends for the support, laughs, advice and friendship over the last few months. 💗 I appreciate you all so much!⁠
⁠
#monochrome #moody #windydunes #sanddunes #monochromatic #stormy #landscapephotography #desertlove #mojavedesert #deathvalley #photographtocreate #expressivephotography #artofvisuals #moodygrams #naturephotography #california #desertstorms #winterinthedesert

Have you ever wondered how to maximize your photographic opportunities when photographing the dunes? Join me today for the Spring Speaker Series, where I will present my talk, "Dynamic Dunes!" Dunes are one of my favorite topics because they're ever-changing and dynamic. ⁠
⁠
 I'll go over everything from photography techniques, adventuring in them, keeping yourself safe and your gear safe, and discuss the opportunities for grand, small and abstract scenes. If you're interested, click the link in my bio above. See you there!⁠
⁠
#sanddunes #dunes #landscapephotography #photographyeducation #naturephotography #california #mojavedesert #desertphotography #desertlove #sand

"Duet" (2017)⁠
⁠
It's National Dolphin Day, and I thought I'd share one of my favorite dolphin photos. These souls have mesmerized me since I was three when my parents first introduced me to the ocean world. Since then, the connection has remained strong throughout life. I'm grateful for the experiences I've had with them, throughout my life. From freediving with Atlantic Spotted dolphins in the Atlantic to photographing and meeting new species in the Pacific, each experience leaves a lasting impact. ⁠
⁠
I was able to get back on the water this week with a camera in hand and had one of the most amazing experiences with a pod of Risso's dolphins aboard @eastmeetswest_whale_watching. I'll be sharing my experience with that soon, along with new dolphin work soon ❤️🐬⁠
⁠
#dolphins #oceanphotography #dolphinlove #commondolphins #pacificocean #monochrome #blackandwhite #naturephotography #createwithlove #nikonnofilter #expressive #cetaceanlove #saveourseas⁠
⁠

That moment when a Risso's dolphin looks directly at you and steals your heart ❤️ ⁠
⁠
This dolphin was very curious and kept turning to look and make eye contact. I'd love to know what they think as they look at us, and there is a soul behind those eyes that resonates with me each time. ⁠
This species isn't particularly known for bow-riding, but this pod was pretty special and hung out with us for over half an hour.⁠
⁠
#rissosdolphin #myfavoritespecies #dolphins #pacificocean #saveourseas #wildlifephotography #monochrome #monochromatic #nature #blackandwhite #cetaceans #exploretocreate #connections #oceanphotography #photographwhatyoulove #natureexperiences #nikonnofilter

"Intertidal" (2022)⁠
⁠
It's important to follow our flashes of perception when we have them. I drove by this scene on a bridge and immediately stopped after the bridge and walked out to photograph this tidal flat from a higher perspective. I loved how the shore dissolved into the sky reflection and the position of the hunting blue heron. By following those flashes of perception, I'm able to be in the moment and shoot what catches my eye without thinking. It's not worrying about what other people think; it's just you, your observations, and your camera capturing those moments that stop you in your tracks. ⁠
⁠
#coastalphotography #ocean #oregon #oregonphotography #tidal #heron #naturephotography #reflections #clouds #water #nikonnofilter #nikonz72 #landscapephotography #smallscene #coastallandscapes #landcapes #capturelandscapes #photographingmoments #exploretocreate #flashesofperception #shootwhatyoulove

"Frozen Architecture" (2022)⁠
⁠
The frozen details and intricacies of an ice pattern last winter captured my eye and lens for a few days, as I spent time exploring the patterns and getting lost in these tiny icy worlds. ⁠
This was a photo of the day last year in December taken for my 2022 #365project. ⁠
⁠
#frozen #ice #icecrystals #winterphotography #cold #naturespatterns #patterns #textures #macrophotography #macro #nikonz72 #naturephotography #macroworlds #exploretocreate #creativephotography #winter #photographyprojects #365projects

"Transcendent" (2022)⁠
⁠
Moments like this are why I wander, wait and observe. Trees on a hillside in Yellowstone were unveiled through the fog by a moment of light and warmth last summer. ⁠
⁠

"Resolute" (2020)⁠
⁠
The morning sun spotlights the Lower Falls as the clouds and fog clear. I'm looking forward to being back in my favorite corner of the world soon. 🧡⁠
⁠
#yellowstone #wyomingphotography #yellowstonelandscapes #yellowstonephotography #waterfall #moody #fog #clearingfog #naturephotography #nature #landscapephotography #landscapecaptures #wyomingcaptures #westyellowstone #nikonz72 #nikonnofilter #moodylandscapes #happyplace #yellowstoneforever

"Terrace Pastels" (2020)⁠
⁠
Let's keep the Yellowstone theme going! Here is a new image from the Mammoth Hot Springs area from a few years ago. Over the years, these terraces have seen many changes, including some areas drying up due to changes in the underground plumbing. While these areas can go dormant, they can also start running and flowing again.⁠
⁠
While it's sad to see at times, it's all an example of how the Yellowstone Ecosystem is in a state of constant change, and it keeps me coming back season after season to explore and photograph the new changes. ⁠
⁠
#mammothhotsprings #yellowstonenationalpark #yellowstoneforever #terraces #pastels #painterly #softlight #naturephotography #landscapecaptures #landscapephotography #smallscenes #geothermal #hotsprings #exploretocreate #colorfulnature #nikonnofilter #wyomingphotography #wyoming

"Amalgamation" (2023)⁠
⁠
Fresh mud, flow patterns, blue shadow and warmth combine to form a pattern of colors and textures in the Mojave Desert.⁠
⁠
Many photographers often ask me how these colors come to be, and fresh mud that reflects is the key. (it rhymes, haha!) A tall channel wall slightly shadowed the blue portion, and the warmer portion was hit by direct, warm light. These colors are natural, and years of observing how light interacts with mud have led me to these types of photos that I enjoy so much. ⁠
⁠
#mud #ilovemud #textures #patterns #warmandcool #mojavedesert #desertlight #abstractphotography #abstracts #freshmud #landcapephotography #photographwhatyoulove #exploretocreate #brilliantnature #nikonz72 #nikonnofilter #mojavelove #desertlove #winterinthedesert #desertpatterns #landscapecaptures

I'm heading back to my favorite corner of the world, to lead our night photography workshops in Grand Teton and Yellowstone National Park. I'm looking forward to sharing the beauty of the night sky among the rugged and otherworldly beauty of these landscapes with our participants 🌌⁠
⁠
#yellowstone #wyoming #wyomingphotography #nightphotography #nightscaper #starryskies #geologyunderthestars #photographyeducation #photographyworkshops #landscapephotography #astrophotography #underthemilkyway #celestial #nikonz72 #nikonnofilter #landscapecaptures #stars

"Evanescence" (2019)⁠
⁠
It's been very moody, overcast and grey here in the Tetons. These conditions take me back to some of my favorite moody conditions I've experienced here over the years. This moment is one of my favorite experiences from some time ago. The sun setting, the luminous and glowy atmosphere, the rain shafts and the clearing clouds were special to watch unfold. ⁠
⁠
#wyoming #wyomingphotography #tetons #mountains #clearingstorm #landscapephotography #sunset #mountainphotography #grandtetonnationalpark #jacksonhole #jacksonwyoming #summerinthemountatins #myfavoritemountains #landscapes #landscapecaptures #naturephotography #painterly #drama #moodyaf #nikonnofilter

"Breakthrough" (2021)⁠
⁠
We're back to having moody and stormy conditions here in Yellowstone. I enjoy photographing Yellowstone in these conditions, and when there is storm light and dappled light, I enjoy shooting certain thermal features. Mammoth hot springs, with its steamy conditions and pastel palette, is a favorite of mine to photograph. We had dappled light and dark skies on this particular day a few years ago. When the sun broke through and highlighted this hillside of terraces, it gave a very painterly effect, and I spent the afternoon following the light across the terraced landscape. ⁠
⁠
#yellowstone #landscapephotography #mammothhotsprings #moodylight #drama #painterly #naturephotography #terraces #wyomingphotography #wyoming #landcapecaptures #naturecaptures #landscapes #nikonnofilter #yellowstoneforever #yellowstonephotography #yellowstonelandscapes #moodygrams #exploretocreate

"Quicksilver"  2023⁠
⁠
Here is a photo from the Olympic coast this past spring. It was my first time there, and it didn't take long for me to find and photograph all sorts of new natural abstracts. These sand patterns on a beach were not only fascinating to photograph but also had tiny puddles of water sitting atop some of the patterns. Those areas of water reflected the gray sky above to create this mesmerizing pattern reminiscent of liquid mercury. ⁠
⁠
#naturalabstracts #photographabstracts #abstractphotography #sand #sandpatterns #smallscene #naturephotography #patterns #textures #details #landscapephotography #nikonnofilter #nikonz2 #walkonthebeach #olympicnationalpark #washingtonstate #washington #olympic #sandy #lowtide #moodygrams #artofvisuals #natureisbrilliant

"Viridescent"  2023⁠
⁠
We had the most amazing airglow I've ever witnessed last week when we were photographing at night at Grand Prismatic Spring in Yellowstone National Park. The airglow reflected in the terraces, mimicking the airglow lines in the sky. I used my new Nikon Z 20mm f/1.8 for astrophotography with my Nikon Z72, and it's now my new favorite astro lens! I'll have a write-up about the lens on my blog soon.⁠
⁠
#astrophotography #airglow #yellowstonenationalpark #NikonCreatorsChallenge #nikonz72 #nightphotography #stars #wyoming #summerskies #landscapephotography #nightscapes #nightscaper #landscapesatnight #naturephotography #landscapecaptures

"Lupine Glory" (2019)⁠
⁠
An explosion of lupine wildflowers covers a field during sunset near Crested Butte, Colorado. ⁠
⁠
We'll head to the mountains in a few days for our wildflowers workshop here in Colorado. I'm looking forward to spending the rest of the summer here in my home state, and I always look forward to heading back to this particular neck of the woods. ⁠
⁠
#wildflowers #crestedbutte #colorado #summer #summerinthemountains #coloradophotography #flowers #lupine #mountains #landscapephotography #naturephotography #coloradowildflowers

This past spring, I went to the Desert Botanical Garden in Phoenix, Arizona, and challenged myself to photograph plants, a subject I have not photographed often. Unsurprisingly, I connected abstractly to the plants and had a wonderful time practicing ICM with them. Here is a small collection of what I photographed. I look forward to more opportunities to photograph more plants in the future. These discoveries can be made when we get out of our comfort zones and play and photograph new subjects!⁠
⁠
My dear friend and colleague @annebelmontphotography encouraged me to explore the world of plants with my camera, and now she has released an exceptional and very inspiring e-book, "The Art of Flower Photography: Capturing the Beauty of Flowers with Creativity and Emotion." This is more than just a flower photography e-book. It's a creative journey into the world of flower photography that goes beyond techniques and into the emotional and creative practices that will take your flower photography to the next level. See my story for the link to learn more and purchase her book. 🌷⁠
⁠
#plants #flowers #plantphotography #icm #creativephotography #exploretocreate #experiment #desertplants #desertbotanicgarden #gardenphotography #naturephotography ⁠

It's been hot here in Denver, so I have ice on my brain. Here's a mix of my favorite things: ice, reflected canyon light and a warm/cool contrast. ⁠
⁠
I'm busy cooking up new images, projects and blog posts. These hot days are great for working on such things, as I enjoy the a/c. ⁠
⁠
#ice #reflectedlight #canyonsinwinter #southwest #warmcool #abstract #abstractphotography #texture #winterice #naturephotography #naturalabstracts #winterdetails #smallscene #landscapephotography

"Serene" 2020⁠
⁠
On the upper terraces of Mammoth Hot Springs, peaceful moments are created by the warm light, steam, and blue thermal pools.⁠
⁠
Following a whirlwind few weeks that took me from Colorado to Chicago, then Colorado to Moab, and finally, Moab to Wyoming, I find myself back in my cherished sanctuary, preparing to lead a workshop next week while dedicating time to healing after a riding accident last week at home.⁠
⁠
I've been quiet on social media this summer, but despite this, I've been diligently working behind the scenes, and I'm excited to share what's in store. I've been crafting an array of fresh photographs, finishing my 365 e-book, and writing some articles to be unveiled in the weeks and months ahead. Stay tuned for those upcoming releases, and thank you, everyone, for your kind messages and well-wishes. 🥰⁠
⁠
#yellowstone #landscapephotography #wyomingphotography #smallscenes #quitemoments #backbehindthelens #pastels #steam #hotsprings #geothermal #capturelandscapes #landscapecaptures #backinmyhappyplace #photographylife #yellowstoneforever #yellowstonenationalpark #naturephotography #naturephotographs

Yellowstone welcomed me back to the area this week with the most stunning aurora display I've ever witnessed in the park to date. The display only lasted about a half hour at its top peak, but it was enthralling to sit back and watch the pillars dance across the sky. I headed to my favorite geyser basin to photograph, and I feel so grateful I was able to capture the magic in one of my favorite places on Earth. ⁠
⁠
#aurora #spaceweather #yellowstonenationalpark #wyoming #wyomingphotography #nightphotography #astrophotography #northernlights #geysers #yellowstoneforever #NikonNoFilter #yellowstone #landscapephotography #landscapes #geothermal #naturephotography #natureisbeautiful #landscapemagic #nightsky #auroraborealis #autumnaurora #nikonz72 #yellowstonephotography

"Watercolors"  2017⁠
⁠
A mix of colors from thermophilic bacteria creates a colorful pattern in a hot spring.⁠
⁠
I've returned to Yellowstone for a few days this week, and this park never loses its magic, no matter how often I've roamed its captivating landscapes with my camera. This is where my passion for capturing natural abstract beauty was born. The mesmerizing patterns woven by thermophilic bacteria continue to ignite my creativity every time I peer through my lens. 🌋⁠
⁠
#yellowstone #naturalabstracts #smallscenes #smallscene #capturinglandscapes #geothermalfeatures #hotspring #wyoming #yellowstoneabstracts #yellowstonebeauty #myhappyplace #landcapes #landscapecaptures #abstractphotography #abstractbeauty #NikonCreators #jacksonhole #westyellowstone #montana

Last year, Zion Canyon experienced a dramatic interplay of moody weather and sporadic storms, resulting in the fleeting emergence of waterfalls. These falls never fail to captivate me, especially in the wake of a refreshing autumn rain. When juxtaposed against the vibrant autumnal hues of the canyon, they compose truly mesmerizing landscapes. ⁠
⁠
#fallcolors #fallincayons #canyons #zion #waterfalls #landscapes #autumnhues #landscapephotography #naturephotography #desertlandscapes #southwestmagic #nature #landscapecaptures #nikonnofilter #utah #zionnationalpark #zioncanyon #waterfall #storms

"Motif" (2021)⁠
⁠
Winter in the canyons of the Colorado Plateau is my favorite time to observe small details from behind my lens. With the colder winter temperatures, ice often forms in pools and along creeks. The ice mixed with the reflected light from canyon walls creates a tapestry of light, color and patterns. From working with and photographing ice for many years, I've learned that many different patterns can form to create interesting and captivating textures and patterns, and they keep me exploring each season.⁠
⁠
#ice #abstractphotography #naturalabstracts #abstract #nature #naturalpatterns #textures #icepatterns #canyonsinwinter #winterphotography #smallscenes #landscapephotography #naturephotography #naturecaptures #nikonnofilter #coloradoplateau #desertphotography #winterinthedesert #observingdetails

I'm unable to be among the canyons and slickrock this fall, and I'm missing the experiences. One of the aspects that I love most about photography is that even if I'm unable to be there this season, looking back on photos from the past, I'm instantly transported back to this river and canyon. Looking at this photo, I can feel the cold rushing water and hear the river's voice as it rushes over the rocks. ⁠
This was taken on a trip a few years ago, and this spot is one of the more popular photography destinations in the canyon. But each year, this spot can look different due to the seasonal changes in water levels, leaving unique patterns with the flowing water over the rocks to photograph. ⁠
⁠
#zioncanyon #utah #utahphotography #redrocks #canyons #rivers #virginriver #magicofcanyons #canyonphotography #landscapephotography #reflectedlight #canyonglow #glowaroundthebend #river #longexposure #naturephotography #naturevisions #landscapecaptures #hikingincanyons

"Matrix" (2022)⁠
⁠
Last winter, I explored many new areas in the Mojave Desert, focusing on areas we hadn't been before. During one of those desert walks, I encountered an area with a tiny collection of salt crystals. Some areas were floating on a thin layer of water, and others had dried on the playa bed. I used my macro lens to appreciate the details and texture, and through that lens, I reminisced right back to my geologist days when I would study rock thin sections under a microscope. It's easy to get lost in the intricacies of these crystals and they're a fascinating subject to observe.⁠
⁠
#mojavedesert #mojaveadventures #abstractphotography #smallscenes #naturalabstracts #crystals #desertwonders #desertphotography #california #landscapephotography #naturephotography #natureabstracts #funtophotograph #nikonnofilter #nikonz7ii⁠

"Denticles"  2019⁠
⁠
The dynamic nature of beaches is an abstract paradise, and wandering on a beach can offer many different opportunities to see and photograph natural abstracts. These sand patterns were illuminated in between retreating waves and reminded me of shark denticles. ⁠
⁠
If you've ever had the opportunity to touch a shark, you will find that they feel very much like sandpaper due to the unique makeup of their skin, which contains denticles. Denticles are microscopic tooth-like scales on the shark's skin that help reduce drag and serve as a barrier against abrasions. ⁠
⁠
The few times I've been diving with sharks, a few have come close and brushed against a bare arm or leg. The feeling reminded me of a nail file rubbing my skin, and it was surprising because their skin appeared so sleek and smooth. ⁠
⁠
Fun fact: Olympic swimsuits have been designed using a fabric that mimics shark denticles to help swimmers reduce drag and help with speed. 🦈 ⁠
⁠
#naturalabstracts #abstractphotography #naturephotography #sharks #landscapephotography #beachphotography #slowphotography #smallscenes #coastalphotography #ocean #waves #sand #patterns #textures #nikonnofilter #natureimages #sharkbiology #sharksareamazing

"Surge" (2019)⁠
⁠
Capturing those moments when the land meets the sea always intrigues me. This is a favorite moment from a few years ago. I enjoyed how the texture of the water retreating after a wave created a scene that reminded me of a wave crashing onto the shore. ⁠
⁠
#ocean #naturalabstract #abstractphotography #abstracts #water #movement #patterns #waves #beachphotography #landscapephotography #details #smallscene #california #nikonnofilter #sand #photographingdetails⁠
⁠

"Sand Grain"  2020⁠
⁠
I stumbled upon this tiny scene a few years ago, wandering around the dunes. The sunlight shining above highlighted this interesting laminated pattern, peeking out from the sand. You can often find exciting textures like this after a weather event like rain. Here, the darker-colored lines were still wet, creating a nice contrast in the layers. This pattern resembles intricate wood grain, and this captivating sight encapsulates why I am drawn to wander these ever-shifting dunes, where each delicate scene unfurls its mesmerizing tale.⁠
⁠
#desertphotography #desertlove #sand #sanddunes #mojavedesert #abstractphotography #abstracts #naturalabstracts #smallscene #landscapephotography #wandering #observing #details #sandydetails #nikonnofilter

"Renew"  2023⁠
⁠
Amid a personally and artistically challenging season, these last weeks spent amidst the desert landscape have been a source of renewal and inspiration. Historically, this desert has been a place of healing for me. I've been enjoying the time wandering the desert, healing, and observing changes to the landscape from August's storms. Lake Manly has been very photographically inspiring to me, and over the past few weeks, it's been fascinating to watch from a viewpoint the changes as the water slowly starts to recede. I photographed this a few weeks ago at the start of my trip, and since then, it's been slowly changing. The landscape is rejuvenating, and so am I. ⁠
⁠
I'll have a collection of new work coming soon from this trip that I'm excited to share as the year draws to a close. ⁠
⁠
#mojavedesert #deathvalley #desertlove #desertphotography #saltflats #abstractphotography #naturalabstracts #nikonnofilter #california #wanderingthedesert #exploretocreate #californiaphotography #landscapephotography #salt #desertmusings #renewal

"Lattice" (2023)⁠
⁠
There have been so many interesting patterns on the dunes lately. Each little scene is a tapestry is woven out by the elements. In this particular one, I loved how each little cubby in the pattern, had its own interesting patterns of lines and layers within. ⁠
⁠
#sand #desert #desertphotography #landscapephotography #naturalabstracts #abstractphotography #natureabstracts #details #smallscenes #sandy #sanddunes #california #mojavedesert #nikonnofilter #desertwanderings #wanderandcreate #textures #patterns

"Illusion" (2018)
Here is a throwback to a unique and unforgettable day when I wandered the badlands after a rain. The morning started early, but patience was rewarded when the sun arrived punching through the clouds to make the saturated ground steamy. I felt like I was wandering through a volcanic landscape. ✨

#deathvalley #desert #california #badlands #rain #steam #moody #moodylandscapes #naturephotography #landscapes #moodynature #nikonnofilter #exploretocreate #winterinthedesert

"Ice Castles" (2022)⁠
⁠
Next week, we're taking a small group into Yellowstone's wintry and magical landscape. I'm very excited to return to experience the magic of winter in this dynamic and ethereal landscape. ⁠
⁠
Here is a new image from my last winter visit to Yellowstone. Nestled within a shroud of steam, a cluster of trees, held captive by winter's icy embrace, emerged through a delicate clearing. A touch of light broke through the overcast sky, and the trees stood resiliently amidst the chill, resembling ancient castles in a distant land. ⁠
⁠
#yellowstone #winterinyellowstone #winterlandscapephotography #winterlandscapes #nikonnofilter #winter #frozen #trees #naturephotography #natureinwinter #frigidlandscapes #smallscene #wintermagic #wyomingphotography #thermalfeatures #steam #moody

"Closing Act" (2022) ⁠
⁠
Steamy and dreamy trees from a winter Yellowstone landscape appear to step into the light from behind the steam in this photo from a few years ago. While these dead trees may seem bleak, they add so much personality to these scenes when they appear to dance in and out of the steam.⁠ ❄️🌲
⁠

"Stardust"  2023⁠
⁠
"The nitrogen in our DNA, the calcium in our teeth, the iron in our blood, the carbon in our apple pies were made in the interiors of collapsing stars. We are made of starstuff." - Carl Sagan⁠
⁠
Here is a departure from what I normally photograph. Back in December, we had the opportunity to visit the Racetrack with a client, via a special permit issued from the park. We spent the night photographing the Geminids, and it was a spectacular evening. This was a first for me, as I had never stayed up all night to photograph a meteor shower with my camera. I had recently finished reading, "Cosmos" by Carl Sagan and affectionately named this rock Carl when I was looking for a composition (hey, it's the little things when you're up all night photographing that keep you entertained!)⁠
⁠
One thing I enjoyed most about Carl Sagan, was his ability to communicate complex science so everyone could understand, and he was ahead of his time predicting what would happen to our planet if we didn't start understanding and listening. This one's for you Carl: thank you for your writings and thoughts that you shared with the world. As a fellow scientist, you've made me appreciate the wonder of the night sky and the universe more deeply. ✨️ 🌌 ☄️⁠
⁠
**Please note: This is a composite**⁠
Camera: NikonZ7ii⁠
Lens: Nikon NIKKOR Z 20mm f/1.8 ⁠
⁠
One shot for the foreground was taken at twilight, one shot for the night sky with Orion, using a fog filter, and a compilation of meteors taken throughout the night, while the camera remained stationed in this composition. ⁠
